Package camzup.core

Class Mesh3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.EntityData
camzup.core.Mesh
camzup.core.Mesh3
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntityData, IMesh, IUtils, Iterable<Face3>
public class Mesh3 extends Mesh implements Iterable<Face3>
Organizes data needed to draw a three dimensional shape with vertices and faces. Given that a mesh is primarily a collection of references, it is initialized with null arrays (coordinates, texture coordinates and indices). These are not final, and so can be reassigned.

  • Field Details

    • coords

      public Vec3[] coords
      An array of coordinates.

    • normals

      public Vec3[] normals
      An array of normals to indicate how light will bounce off the mesh.

    • texCoords

      public Vec2[] texCoords
      The texture (UV) coordinates that describe how an image is mapped onto the mesh. Typically in the range [0.0, 1.0] .

    • DEFAULT_CUBE_SIZE

      public static final float DEFAULT_CUBE_SIZE
      Default cube size, such that it will match the dimensions of other Platonic solids; 0.5d / Math.sqrt(2.0d) , approximately 0.3535533845424652f .
      See Also:

      public static final int DEFAULT_SPHERE_ITR

    • Mesh3

      public Mesh3(int[][][] faces, Vec3[] coords, Vec2[] texCoords, Vec3[] normals)
      Creates a mesh from arrays of faces, coordinates, texture coordinates and normals. The mesh's arrays are set by reference, not by value.
      Parameters:
      faces - the faces array
      coords - the coordinates array
      texCoords - the texture coordinates array
      normals - the normals array

  • Method Details

    • calcUvs

      public Mesh3 calcUvs()
      Calculates texture coordinates (UVs) for this mesh. Converts a vertex's index in a face loop to an angle, then to Cartesian coordinates.
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Utils.div(float, float)
      • Vec2.resize(Vec2[], int)

    • clean

      public Mesh3 clean()
      Removes elements from the coordinate, texture coordinate and normal arrays of the mesh which are not visited by the face indices.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • collapseEdge

      public Mesh3 collapseEdge(int faceIndex, int edgeIndex)
      Collapses an edge to a point. Unlike deleteVerts(int, int, int), inserts a midpoint between edge origin and destination.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      edgeIndex - the edge index
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • collapseEdge

      public Mesh3 collapseEdge(int faceIndex, int edgeIndex, float fac)
      Collapses an edge to a point. Unlike deleteVerts(int, int, int), inserts a newly created vertex between edge origin and destination according to a factor in [0.0, 1.0]; a factor of 0.5 will collapse an edge to its midpoint; of 0.0, to its origin; of 1.0, to its destination.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      edgeIndex - the edge index
      fac - the offset factor
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Utils.mod(int, int)
      • Utils.clamp01(float)
      • Vec3.normalize(Vec3, Vec3)

    • deleteFace

      public Mesh3 deleteFace(int faceIndex)
      Removes a face indices from this mesh beginning at an index. Does not remove any data associated with the indices.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the index
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • deleteFaces(int, int)

      amount - the extrusion amount
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • extrudeFace

      public Mesh3 extrudeFace(int faceIndex, boolean fillCap, float depth)
      Extrudes a face by an amount. Creates quadrilateral sides to connect extruded face to original. Does not check whether a face is bordered by other faces; best used on disconnected faces.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      fillCap - whether to cap the extruded face
      depth - the extrusion depth
      Returns:
      this new face indices

    • extrudeFace

      public Mesh3 extrudeFace(int faceIndex, boolean fillCap, float depth, float taper)
      Extrudes a face by an amount. Creates quadrilateral sides to connect extruded face to original. Does not check whether a face is bordered by other faces; best used on disconnected faces. The taper is a scalar applied to a face's size, e.g., a taper of .75 would result in an extruded face 75% the size of the original.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      fillCap - whether to cap the extruded face
      depth - the extrusion depth
      taper - the taper
      Returns:
      this new face indices
      See Also:
      • shadeFlat(int, int)
      • Utils.max(float, float)
      • Utils.mod(int, int)
      • Vec3.add(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.div(Vec3, float, Vec3)
      • Vec3.negate(Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.normalize(Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.sub(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

    • extrudeFaces

      public Mesh3 extrudeFaces(boolean fillCap, float depth)
      Extrudes all faces in the mesh by an amount. Creates quadrilateral sides to connect extruded face to original. Does not check as to whether a face is an bordered by other faces; best used on disconnected faces.
      Parameters:
      fillCap - whether to cap the extruded faces
      depth - the extrusion depth
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • extrudeFaces

      public Mesh3 extrudeFaces(boolean fillCap, float depth, float taper)
      Extrudes all faces in the mesh by an amount. Creates quadrilateral sides to connect extruded face to original. Does not check as to whether a face is an bordered by other faces; best used on disconnected faces. The taper is a scalar applied to a face's size, e.g., a taper of .75 would result in an extruded face 75% the size of the original.
      Parameters:
      fillCap - whether to cap the extruded faces
      depth - the extrusion depth
      taper - the taper
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • flipU

      public Mesh3 flipU()
      Negates the x component of all texture coordinates (u) in the mesh. Does so by subtracting the value from 1.0.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • flipV

      public Mesh3 flipV()
      Negates the y component of all texture coordinates (v) in the mesh. Does so by subtracting the value from 1.0.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • flipX

      public Mesh3 flipX()
      Negates the x component of all coordinates in the mesh, then reverses the mesh's faces. Use this instead of scale(Vec3) with the argument new Vec3(-1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f).
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Mesh.reverseFaces()

    • flipY

      public Mesh3 flipY()
      Negates the y component of all coordinates in the mesh, then reverses the mesh's faces. Use this instead of scale(Vec3) with the argument new Vec2(1.0f, -1.0f, 1.0f).
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Mesh.reverseFaces()

    • flipZ

      public Mesh3 flipZ()
      Negates the z component of all coordinates in the mesh, then reverses the mesh's faces. Use this instead of scale(Vec3) with the argument new Vec3(1.0f, 1.0f, -1.0f).
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Mesh.reverseFaces()

      public Edge3[] getEdgesDirected()

      the edges array

    • getEdgesUndirected

      public Edge3[] getEdgesUndirected()
      Gets an array of edges from the mesh. Edges are treated as undirected, so (origin, destination) and (destination, edge) are considered to be the same.
      Returns:
      the edges array

    • insetFace

      public Mesh3 insetFace(int faceIndex)
      Insets a face by calculating its center then easing from the face's vertices toward the center by 0.5.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • insetFace

      public Mesh3 insetFace(int faceIndex, float fac)
      Insets a face by calculating its center then easing from the face's vertices toward the center by the factor. The factor is expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0] . When it is less than 0.0, the face remains unchanged; when it is greater than 1.0, the face is subdivided by center.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      fac - the inset amount
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh3 insetFaces()
      Insets all faces in the mesh once.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh3 insetFaces(int itr)
      Insets all faces in the mesh for a given number of iterations by a factor of 0.5 .
      Parameters:
      itr - the iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh3 insetFaces(int itr, float fac)
      Insets all faces in the mesh for a given number of iterations by a factor in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      itr - the iterations
      fac - the inset factor
      Returns:
      this mesh

      public Mesh3 reframe(Transform3 tr)
      Centers the mesh about the origin, (0.0, 0.0, 0.0), and rescales it to the range [-0.5, 0.5] . Emits a transform which records the mesh's center point and original dimension. The transform's rotation is reset.

    • shade

      public Mesh3 shade()
      Calculates the normals of a mesh.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • shadeFlat

      public Mesh3 shadeFlat()
      Calculates this mesh's normals per face, resulting in flat shading. If the normals array is null, or if its length is not equal to the length of coordinates, the normals array is reallocated. Sums the cross products of edges in a face

      ( b - a ) x ( c - a )

      then normalizes the sum.
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • shadeFlat(int, int)

    • shadeSmooth

      public Mesh3 shadeSmooth()
      Calculates this mesh's normals per vertex, resulting in smooth shading. If the normals array is null, or if its length is not equal to the length of coordinates, the normals array is reallocated. Uses the formula

      ( b - a ) x ( c - a )

      where a, b and c are three corners of a face, then normalizes the cross product.
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Vec3.crossNorm(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.resize(Vec3[], int)
      • Vec3.sub(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

    • subdivEdge

      public Mesh3 subdivEdge(int faceIndex, int edgeIndex)
      Subdivides an edge by a cut at its midpoint. Does not distinguish between interior edges, which have a complement elsewhere, and border edges; for that reason this works best with NGONs.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      edgeIndex - the edge index
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • subdivEdge

      public Mesh3 subdivEdge(int faceIndex, int edgeIndex, int cuts)
      Subdivides an edge by the number of cuts given. For example, one cut will divide an edge in half; two cuts, into thirds.

      Does not distinguish between interior edges, which have a complement elsewhere, and border edges; for that reason this works best with NGONs.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      edgeIndex - the edge index
      cuts - number of cuts
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      • Vec3.normalize(Vec3, Vec3)

    • subdivFace

      public Mesh3 subdivFace(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face. Defaults to center-based subdivision.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceCenter

      public Mesh3 subdivFaceCenter(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by calculating its center, subdividing each of its edges with one cut to create a midpoint, then connecting the midpoints to the center. This generates a quadrilateral for the number of edges in the face.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceFan

      public Mesh3 subdivFaceFan(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by calculating its center, then connecting its vertices to the center. This generates a triangle for the number of edges in the face.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceInscribe

      public Mesh3 subdivFaceInscribe(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by cutting each of its edges once to create a midpoint, then connecting each midpoint. This generates peripheral triangles and a new central face with the same number of edges as the original. This is best suited to meshes made of triangles.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaces

      public Mesh3 subdivFaces()

      Returns:
      this mesh

      public String toObjString()
      Renders the mesh as a string following the Wavefront OBJ file format.
      Returns:
      the string

    • toObjString

      public String toObjString(int vIdx, int vtIdx, int vnIdx, int smoothShading, boolean flipvs)
      Renders the mesh as a string following the Wavefront OBJ file format. The index offsets specify where the mesh's data begin; OBJ file indices begin at 1, not 0. The mesh is considered a group, 'g', not an object, 'o'.
      Parameters:
      vIdx - coordinate index offset
      vtIdx - texture coordinate index offset
      vnIdx - normal index offset
      smoothShading - smooth shading flag
      flipvs - whether to subtract y from 1.0
      Returns:
      the string

      Parameters:
      tr - the output transform
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • cubeSphere

      public static Mesh3 cubeSphere(int itrs, Mesh3 target)

      Parameters:
      itrs - iterations
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the cube sphere

    • cubeSphere

      public static Mesh3 cubeSphere(int itrs, PolyType poly, UvProfile.Cube profile, Mesh3 target)

    • detachFaces

      public static Mesh3[] detachFaces(Mesh3 source)
      Creates an array of meshes, each with one face from the source mesh. Leaves the source mesh unaltered. New meshes are created through visitation of each face in the source, so they may contain redundant data to be removed with clean().
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh array

    • fromCurve3

      public static Mesh3 fromCurve3(Curve3 source, int resolution, float colinearTol, Mesh3 target)
      Converts a curve to a mesh. If the fore handle and rear handle of a curve segment are colinear according to a tolerance, then only two vertices are added; otherwise evaluates the Bezier curve, producing one line segment per the requested resolution.
      Parameters:
      source - the source curve
      resolution - the line segment count
      colinearTol - the colinear tolerance
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh
      See Also:
      • calcUvs()
      • shadeSmooth()

    • fromCurve3

      public static Mesh3 fromCurve3(Curve3[] arr, int resolution, float colinearTol, Mesh3 target)
      Converts an array of curves to a mesh. If the fore handle and rear handle of a curve segment are colinear according to a tolerance, then only two vertices are added; otherwise evaluates the Bezier curve, producing one line segment per the requested resolution.
      Parameters:
      arr - the source curves
      resolution - the line segment count
      colinearTol - the colinear tolerance
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh
      See Also:
      • calcUvs()
      • shadeSmooth()

    • groupByMaterial

      public static final Mesh3[] groupByMaterial(Mesh3[] meshes)
      Groups separate meshes with the same material index into a mesh. Returns a new array of meshes. Do not use if source meshes need to be transformed independently.
      Parameters:
      meshes - the array of meshes
      Returns:
      the consolidated meshes

      Merges the data of a collection of meshes together into one mesh.
      Parameters:
      coll - the array
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the merger

      Returns:
      the icosahedron

    • icosphere

      public static Mesh3 icosphere(int itrs, Mesh3 target)
      Creates an icosahedron, subdivides through inscription, then casts the vertices to a sphere. The higher the iteration, the more sphere-like the result at the cost of performance.
      Parameters:
      itrs - iterations
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the icosphere
      See Also:
      • castToSphere(Mesh3, float, Mesh3)
      • clean()
      • icosahedron(Mesh3)
      • subdivFaceInscribe(int)

    • icosphere

      public static Mesh3 icosphere(Mesh3 target)
      Creates an icosahedron, subdivides through inscription, then casts the vertices to a sphere. For iterations, uses DEFAULT_SPHERE_ITR, 3.
      Parameters:
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the icosphere

      Returns:
      the octahedron

    • project

      public static Mesh2 project(Mesh3 source, Mat4 projection, Mat4 camera, Mesh2 target)
      Projects a 3D mesh onto a 2D surface, returning the 2D mesh projection. The camera matrix is the same as the model-view matrix. To generate the required inputs, see Mat4.perspective(float, float, float, float, Mat4) and Mat4.camera(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3, Handedness, Mat4, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3).

      Occluded faces are not culled from the 2D mesh.
      Parameters:
      source - the input mesh
      projection - the projection matrix
      camera - the camera matrix
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the projected mesh
      See Also:
      • Mat4.mul(Mat4, Vec4, Vec4)

    • proximity

      public static Map<Float,Vert3> proximity(Mesh3 m, Vec3 p, float nearBound, float farBound)
      Returns a collection of mesh vertices organized by their proximity to a point. The proximity is expressed as a factor where the nearest vertex is on the nearBound; the farthest is on the farBound. Any function which mutates a vertex's properties by such a factor can be applied to the collection.

      The Euclidean distance from a point is unsigned, so two points may have approximately the same distance from the point yet be in different quadrants of the Cartesian coordinate system, i.e. not organized by proximity to each other.
      Parameters:
      m - the mesh
      p - the point
      nearBound - the factor near bound
      farBound - the factor far bound
      Returns:
      the collection
      See Also:
      • getVertices()
      • Vec3.distSq(Vec3, Vec3)

    • tracePerimeter

      public static Mesh3 tracePerimeter(Mesh3 source, int count, float offset, Mesh3 target)
      Traces the perimeter of each face of the source mesh. Returns a target mesh where all faces have the number of vertices specified by the count; each face will be inscribed within the source face, where the target vertices lie on an edge of the source. The perimeter is treated as a percent in the range [0.0, 1.0] , so, for example, a square face's corners will occur at 0.0, 0.25, 0.5 and 0.75 .
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh
      count - the number of vertices
      offset - the factor offset
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the traced mesh

    • uniformData

      public static Mesh3 uniformData(Mesh3 source, Mesh3 target)
      Restructures the mesh so that each face index refers to unique data, indifferent to redundancies. As a consequence, coordinate, texture coordinate and normal arrays are of equal length and face indices are easier to read and understand. Useful for making a mesh similar to those in Unity or p5js . Similar to 'ripping' vertices or 'tearing' edges in Blender.
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh
      target - the target mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh

    • uvSphere

      public static Mesh3 uvSphere(int longitudes, int latitudes, Mesh3 target)
      Creates a UV sphere. The longitudes, or meridians, run through the sphere's poles, and correspond to the azimuth in spherical coordinates. The latitudes correspond to the inclination.
      Parameters:
      longitudes - the longitudes
      latitudes - the latitudes
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the sphere

    • uvSphere

      public static Mesh3 uvSphere(int longitudes, int latitudes, PolyType poly, Mesh3 target)
      Creates a UV sphere. The longitudes, or meridians, run through the sphere's poles, and correspond to the azimuth in spherical coordinates. The latitudes correspond to the inclination. Supplying half as many latitudes as longitudes will provide the best results.
      Parameters:
      longitudes - the longitudes
      latitudes - the latitudes
      poly - the polygon type
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the sphere

    • uvSphere

      public static Mesh3 uvSphere(Mesh3 target)
      Creates a UV sphere. The longitudes, or meridians, run through the sphere's poles, and correspond to the azimuth in spherical coordinates. The latitudes correspond to the inclination.
      Parameters:
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the sphere
